metadata.Title: CVE-2021-20296 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in OpenEXR in versions before 3.0.0-beta. A crafted inputfile supplied by an attacker, that is processed by the Dwa decompressionfunctionality of OpenEXR's IlmImf library, could cause a NULL pointerdereference. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-20296` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr22 - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1
openexr - 2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openexr package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.0-10ubuntu2.6+esm1').
